segment.name: Interchange Control Header
segment.description: To start and identify an interchange of zero or more functional groups and interchange-related control segments

dataElement.name: Authorization Information Qualifier
dataElement.description: Code to identify the type of information in the Authorization Information

dataElement.name: Authorization Information
dataElement.description: Information used for additional identification or authorization of the interchange sender or the data in the interchange; the type of information is set by the Authorization Information Qualifier (I01)

dataElement.name: Security Information Qualifier
dataElement.description: Code to identify the type of information in the Security Information

dataElement.name: Security Information
dataElement.description: This is used for identifying the security information about the interchange sender or the data in the interchange; the type of information is set by the Security Information Qualifier (I03)

dataElement.name: Interchange ID Qualifier
dataElement.description: Qualifier to designate the system/method of code structure used to designate the sender or receiver ID element being qualified

dataElement.name: Interchange Sender ID
dataElement.description: Identification code published by the sender for other parties to use as the receiver ID to route data to them; the sender always codes this value in the sender ID element

dataElement.name: Interchange ID Qualifier
dataElement.description: Qualifier to designate the system/method of code structure used to designate the sender or receiver ID element being qualified

dataElement.name: Interchange Receiver ID
dataElement.description: Identification code published by the receiver of the data; When sending, it is used by the sender as their sending ID, thus other parties sending to them will use this as a receiving ID to route data to them

dataElement.name: Interchange Date
dataElement.description: Date of the interchange

dataElement.name: Interchange Time
dataElement.description: Time of the interchange

dataElement.name: Interchange Control Standards Identifier
dataElement.description: Code to identify the agency responsible for the control standard used by the message that is enclosed by the interchange header and trailer

dataElement.name: Interchange Control Version Number
dataElement.description: This version number covers the interchange control segments

dataElement.name: Interchange Control Number
dataElement.description: A control number assigned by the interchange sender

dataElement.name: Acknowledgment Requested
dataElement.description: Code sent by the sender to request an interchange acknowledgment (TA1)

dataElement.name: Usage Indicator
dataElement.description: Code to indicate whether data enclosed by this interchange envelope is test, production or information

dataElement.name: Component Element Separator
dataElement.description: Type is not applicable; the component element separator is a delimiter and not a data element; this field provides the delimiter used to separate component data elements within a composite data structure; this value must be different than the data element separator and the segment terminator

segment.name: Grade of Service Request Segment
segment.description: To request a delivery priority for this interchange higher or lower than normally provided

dataElement.name: Grade of Service Code
dataElement.description: This indicates the relative urgency of the interchange as determined by the interchange sender

segment.name: Deferred Delivery Request Segment
segment.description: To specify the earliest time when the interchange can be delivered

dataElement.name: Delivery Date
dataElement.description: This is the earliest date the interchange can be delivered to the recipient

dataElement.name: Delivery Time
dataElement.description: This is the earliest time the interchange can be delivered to the recipient

dataElement.name: Delivery Time Code
dataElement.description: Code identifying the delivery time; in accordance with International Organization for Standardization (ISO) standard 8601, time can be specified by a + or - and an indication in hours in relation to universal time coordination (UTC) time; since + is a restricted character, the + and - are substituted by P and M in the codes that follow

segment.name: Interchange Acknowledgment
segment.description: To report the status of processing a received interchange header and trailer or the non-delivery by a network provider

dataElement.name: Interchange Control Number
dataElement.description: A control number assigned by the interchange sender

dataElement.name: Interchange Date
dataElement.description: Date of the interchange

dataElement.name: Interchange Time
dataElement.description: Time of the interchange

dataElement.name: Interchange Acknowledgment Code
dataElement.description: This indicates the status of the receipt of the interchange control structure

dataElement.name: Interchange Note Code
dataElement.description: This numeric code indicates the error found processing the interchange control structure

segment.name: Functional Group Header
segment.description: To indicate the beginning of a functional group and to provide control information

dataElement.name: Functional Identifier Code
dataElement.description: Code identifying a group of application related transaction sets

dataElement.name: Application Sender's Code
dataElement.description: Code identifying party sending transmission; codes agreed to by trading partners

dataElement.name: Application Receiver's Code
dataElement.description: Code identifying party receiving transmission; codes agreed to by trading partners

dataElement.name: Date
dataElement.description: Date expressed as CCYYMMDD

dataElement.name: Time
dataElement.description: Time expressed in 24-hour clock time as follows: HHMM, or HHMMSS, or HHMMSSD, or HHMMSSDD, where H = hours (00-23), M = minutes (00-59), S = integer seconds (00-59) and DD = decimal seconds; decimal seconds are expressed as follows: D = tenths (0-9) and DD = hundredths (00-99)

dataElement.name: Group Control Number
dataElement.description: Assigned number originated and maintained by the sender

dataElement.name: Responsible Agency Code
dataElement.description: Code used in conjunction with Data Element 480 to identify the issuer of the standard

dataElement.name: Version / Release / Industry Identifier Code
dataElement.description: Code indicating the version, release, subrelease, and industry identifier of the EDI standard being used, including the GS and GE segments; if code in DE455 in GS segment is X, then in DE 480 positions 1-3 are the version number; positions 4-6 are the release and subrelease, level of the version; and positions 7-12 are the industry or trade association identifiers (optionally assigned by user); if code in DE455 in GS segment is T, then other formats are allowed

segment.name: Functional Group Trailer
segment.description: To indicate the end of a functional group and to provide control information

dataElement.name: Number of Transaction Sets Included
dataElement.description: Total number of transaction sets included in the functional group or interchange (transmission) group terminated by the trailer containing this data element

dataElement.name: Group Control Number
dataElement.description: Assigned number originated and maintained by the sender

segment.name: Interchange Control Trailer
segment.description: To define the end of an interchange of zero or more functional groups and interchange-related control segments

dataElement.name: Number of Included Functional Groups
dataElement.description: A count of the number of functional groups included in an interchange

dataElement.name: Interchange Control Number
dataElement.description: A control number assigned by the interchange sender
